I care.
just one thing I'm missing, besides the chance to help directly.
what about sustainability and environmental assessment of a loan?
lets say for example - a "carbon neutral" loan gets a zero or a negative interest, on the other hand, a non-environmental friendly loan has a three or even more percentage interest charge which goes directly to projects funding permaculture projects, rainforest or nature habitat protection and even alternative energy research and production.
it would be a much better achievement to help the people to live a more traditional way with no fertilizers, GMO seeds or gas guzzling services.
we should have a discussion on that issue.

It's very easy for me, in my priviledged position as a white male in north america, to make a few extra bucks. I see this organization as one chance for priviledged individuals to share their wealth without charity or capitalism. i can't think of very many aspects of globalization that i agree with and certainly not many i support.....here's one.
lender.occupational_info: I work seasonal jobs across different parts of the u.s. and pick up random work along the way. I try to work jobs that pay me in cash so i can pay this corrupt, war mongering goverment the fewest taxes possible. My real work is attempting to move around freely and happily, causing as little damage to this precious earth as possible and feeling love for myself and other beings.

I also believe that what you give to the universe will be returned to you and it's this philosophy that I bring to Kiva.
